revised_title: Perceptual Experiments and Language Theories: Psychological Mechanisms
tldr: This article discusses the psychological mechanisms of language processing and understanding. It explores perceptual experiments and language theories, highlighting the discrepancies between the understanding of linguists and the general public. The author suggests that people use heuristic strategies and contextual understanding to process sentences, rather than strictly following grammatical rules. The article also touches upon the identification of isolated words and the role of context in language comprehension.
